ch.unifr.pai.twice.utils.device.client
Class UUID

java.lang.Object
  ch.unifr.pai.twice.utils.device.client.UUID

public class UUID
extends java.lang.Object

UUID holder - this class allows to identify a specific device session by the initial generation of a unique identifier (UUID) which is hold throughout the whole client session and therefore can be used as a identifier for the device within the collaborative session. To keep the same UUID even if the client session is interrupted (e.g. by closing the browser window), this implementation tries to store and recover the once generated UUID in the HTML5 session storage if available.

Author:
Oliver Schmid

Constructor Detail

UUID

public UUID()
Method Detail

get

public static java.lang.String get()
If no identifier is defined, this method tries to recover it from the HTML5 session storage if available or generates a new UUID and stores it if possible.

Returns:
the currently valid identifier of this device (the return value is never null!)

createNew

public static java.lang.String createNew()
Creates a new unique identifier but doesn't store it as the client's identifier. This is a useful method if other components (e.g. events) need to have their own unique identifier.

Returns:
a new unique identifier

getUUIDForEvent

public static java.lang.String getUUIDForEvent(com.google.gwt.dom.client.NativeEvent event)
Parameters:
event -
Returns:
the unique identifier of an extended native event - null if the event doesn't contain device information (e.g. if they are originating from native input devices)
